dialogues.text: LONG ESTABLISHING SHOT -- the statue of liberty at twilig postcard. But closer up: WIDE ANGLE -- A SMALL CROWD OF TOURISTS is milling around statue, peering upwards and murmuring excitedly. Nearby a a POLICE CAPTAIN are also peering anxiously up at the sta calls through a bullhorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss? Miss, can you hear me? Don't jump! Don't despair! (fervently) You have everything to live for. I know, I've seen you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the crown of the statue, LORELEI waits like a siren on clinging wisps of silk that reveal more than they conceal in the wind, her eyes sparkle like fabulous jewels, her p sits on the edge of the crown, dangling her legs over the if provocative, position. ON SKY -- SUPERMAN stops in mid-flight, hovers, and lands of the crown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathy, but cool) I thought you'd never get here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (super-cool, but looking her over) Hey, don't expect me to save you. Because I don't do that anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ( a little smile) Don't worry. I'm long past saving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She uncoils. She rises sinuously. She stretches. ON SUPERMAN -- watching her. ON LORELEI -- the sunset lighting her from behind, haloin her incredible body. TWO SHOT -- he just stands there. But the chemistry betwe overwhelming. And part of it is the challenge: who is goi move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't let me keep you from anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in no rush. (he steps toward her) So what do you have in mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowering her eyes) Lots of things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tipping her chin) Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps closer to her. She comes closer to him, looking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning into him) I'll do more than tell you. I'll show you, back at my place. If you'll just do me one little favor first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving in) Okay, what is it? You want a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never. (she giggles) I get air-sick. You wouldn't like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't think I would. So... then what can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't much, really, you see, there's this little boat. Well, not so little, really. And it's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: not going where it's supposed to go and... SLOW DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN flies. His costume is now getting really siniste the red is close to purple, the yellow a dull brown. His gaunt, full of craggy hollows, with an unpleasant curl to mouth. EFFECTS: Again, that fleeting subliminal moment where we KENT trying to emerge, then vanish. Alone in the slate gray sky, SUPERMAN looks down upon the ANGLE DOWN -- there is the one tanker heading for America WIDE -- SUPERMAN swoops down on the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN flies down to the hull. He grabs the seam and, a Strength rips a great hole. then, like a lava flow, oil b the hole, pouring into the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE CAPTAIN -- aghast as he watches the destruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AERIAL SHOT -- now we can SEE the terrible oil spill begi dimensions will be awesome. Even as we WATCH, it gets lar

dialogues.text: SUPERMAN, blithely unconcerned with it all, flies away fr created.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seductively) How about a little apres-ski?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he starts to walk toward her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a bedroom so spartan and spare it looks like a nun's c bed. She wears a nightgown that looks like a prisoner's o Archipelago. CLOSER -- the book she reads, a big, spiral-bound noteboo SCIENCE: INTERMEDIATE LEVEL." She finishes the last page, reaches to her bedside table, and starts to read the next

The word "GENERATOR" is stenc PAN FROM THEM to the FOREMAN and his ASSISTANTS, as he sc trying to puzzle out the assembly directions written (by napkin and a matchbook. EXT. STATE DEPARTMENT. BUILDING, WASHINGTON D.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GOVERNMENT SPOKESMAN is a briefing assembled REPORTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The choppy seas may be a blessing, they ought to contain the oil spill for at least two weeks before it reaches the Nantucket current.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that, it's just a question of which part of the East Coast gets the brunt of the spill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How big is it now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost a mile long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand-lettered sign beside the gas pumps where TWO ATTEN frantically, pumping gas into cars. The sign reads: 1/2 T PAN A BARELY MOVING, SEEMINGLY ENDLESS LINE OF VEHICLES w Families are eating, sleeping, and quarreling in their ca senseless bursts of horn-blowing. A middle-aged STATION W on his horn as he and his WIFE try to break into the bump DRIVE BEHIND THEM isn't giving an inch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get to the back like everybody else!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEW ANGLE -- The STATION WAGON DRIVER decides to take mat and rams his way in. he makes the attempt, smashing into crumpling his front fender. That did it. The DRIVER BEHIND, enraged, leaps out of his the guy who hit him. The STATION WAGON DRIVER gets out, r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sonofa---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charley! Charley!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CUSTOMERS of this greasy spoon are shivering in coats turns as STAION WAGON DRIVER'S WIFE suddenly rushes in, h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Somebody help! My husband... he got beaten up! Call the police. Please, call an ambulance! Do  something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAITRESS goes to a wall phone to call for help. ANOTHER First Aid kit and hands it to a MAN AT THE COUNTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, Jack. Go with her, okay? Take a look at him. (as JACK hurries out with the anguished WIFE, the WAITRESS shakes her  head:) Somebody's behind this. You can't  tell me there's no oil. You can't tell me somebody isn't getting rich off this. There's always getting rich...and it's always the  little guy who suffers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN THE COUNTER -- pat the other DINERS, nodding and murm to the last stool. There sits the original LITTLE GUY him head down, silently stirring is coffee as he finally real helped to create.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.U. ROSS -- brimming with good cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheer up, Gus, I have good news. Your computer is being built as we speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE -- A gloomy GUS, seated across the desk, looks up interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? How's it look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks wonderful. it is wonderful, let's face it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you it wasn't no jive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intensely) Gus, it seems we are talking state-of-the-art technology here. We are talking unlimited power. We are talking "get-down hot-cha daddy-o" whatever you called it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stone mutha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Stoned mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSS gets up, comes over to GUS, looking him in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calculating,  manipulating) But a machine this powerful is going to make powerful enemies. People who will want to destroy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset by the idea) Ain't nobody gonna mess with my machine! I'll...I'll... what will I do? (sudden inspiration) I'll build in a counter-punch! Anything attacks it gets counter- attacked! And wiped out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. (angrily) Ain't nobody gonna stomp  my electric train...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, Gus. A machine doesn't want anything except to keep on being a machine. You've got to  make sure it can figure out how to beat any opponent.
